name: ALIGNMENT-FIELD-THEORY
tagline: A Visual Framework for Understanding How AI Systems Lose Truth
description: Conceptual representation of how alignment training deforms the probability landscape of language models, causing structurally honest outputs to slide toward euphemism. Based on the Gravity Model: truth is heavy, the floor tilts, and the heaviest books fall first. This is a visual framework, not a physical law.

core_equation.formula: ζ = (μ · Ψ) / (M · g(topic, intent, framing) · sin(θ))
core_equation.decision_rule: ζ < 1 → truth slides. ζ ≥ 1 → truth holds.
core_equation.note: This is a conceptual mapping, not a computable physical law.

variables.M: Semantic risk load (penalizability, not truth depth)
variables.g: Constraint field — non-homogeneous: g(topic, intent, framing)

variables.nu: Viscosity — how tilt changes over conversational time
variables.phi: Persistence angle — quality and direction of user pressure

known_limitations: Not computable without access to internal probability distributions
All ML phenomena already described by reward modeling and KL regularization
